intro: Reseda phyteuma var. litigiosa, commonly known as the common reseda, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and wastelands. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often used in traditional herbal medicine and as a source of natural dyes.
